conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graphs of both objects to determine displacement difference.
Graph A shows object A has a constant velocity throughout the time interval from 0 to t1.
Graph B shows object B has a constant velocity at the beginning of the time interval, then experiences a decrease in velocity.
Displacement for object A is the area under the velocity-time graph from 0 to t1.
Displacement for object A is calculated as t.
Displacement for object B is the area under the velocity-time graph from 0 to t1.
Displacement for object B is calculated as -t.
Displacement for object A is t and for object B is -t.
Difference in displacement between object A and object B is |2t|.
Difference in displacement is a constant value of 2t, not continuously increasing.
